result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey John Russell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF374, 14CF466 and 15CF174:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared. Case called at 9:52 a.m. ADA McKinley states there is a joint recommendation. Recites agreement. Atty Schwab in agreement. Will waive any preliminary hearing not held in any of the files. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1  OWI 5th in 14CF374. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 5th in 14CF374. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 2 in 14CF374. Court dismisses and reads in 14CF466 and 15CF174. Sentencing arguments. Defendant gives statement. Crt orders:

I/S a bifercated sentence of 6 years total confinement
      - 3 years initial confinement, 3 years ES

- S/W 3 years probation

Conditions of probation:
- 1 year county jail. If becomes employed, court will grant Huber. 32 days jail credit subject to objection from the DA's Office. State has 10 days to file an objection on jail credit.

- If the stay is lifted, defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

- Fine in the amount of $1,284.00. Bond on file to apply to fine. To be paid over the course of probation

- DNA Sample and Surcharge

- Blood draw fee in the amount of $85.50 to be paid to New Richmond Police Department

- Drivers license revoked for a period of 24 months

- IID for a period of 24 months

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF374, 14CF466 and 15CF174: 
  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared. Case called at 2:54 p.m. ADA McKinley states a resolution has been reached and doesn't request a PSI. Atty Schwab waives order for PSI. Address confirmed. Bond continues. hml  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Evenson. ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared. Case called at 2:32. Includes 14CF374, 14CF466, 15CF174. ADA Collins updates the court and requests to set it for trial. Atty. Schwab agrees. Atty.'s to see JA for scheduling. FPT  to be scheduled 2 weeks prior to JT.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF374,14CF466 and 15CF174:
CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle ADA: Francis Collins  DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared. Case called at 11:31 a.m. ADA Collins makes statement. Atty Schwab just retained and needs to provide discovery. Atty Schwab requesting status out 30 days. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. hml  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by L. Nelson. Re: appointment of counsel on case. km
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Commissioner Heckmann for RMW. REP: Erin Drost. Clerk: Liddle. ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared from jail. Case called at 1:03 pm. Address confirmed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waives speedy prelim. hml 
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S:  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
